org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.nfs.nfs3

Class WriteCtx

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.nfs.nfs3.WriteCtx

  •  class WriteCtx
extends Object
    WriteCtx saves the context of one write request, such as request, channel, xid and reply status.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  WriteCtx.DataState
      In memory write data has 3 states.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        public static final org.apache.commons.logging.Log LOG

      • handle

        private final org.apache.hadoop.nfs.nfs3.FileHandle handle

      • offset

        private final long offset

      • count

        private final int count

      • originalCount

        private final int originalCount
        Some clients can send a write that includes previously written data along with new data. In such case the write request is changed to write from only the new data. originalCount tracks the number of bytes sent in the request before it was modified to write only the new data.
        See Also:
        for more details

      • INVALID_ORIGINAL_COUNT

        public static final int INVALID_ORIGINAL_COUNT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stableHow

        private final org.apache.hadoop.nfs.nfs3.Nfs3Constant.WriteStableHow stableHow

      • data

        private volatile ByteBuffer data

      • channel

        private final org.jboss.netty.channel.Channel channel

      • xid

        private final int xid

      • replied

        private boolean replied

      • raf

        private RandomAccessFile raf
        Data belonging to the same OpenFileCtx may be dumped to a file. After being dumped to the file, the corresponding WriteCtx records the dump file and the offset.

      • dumpFileOffset

        private long dumpFileOffset

      • dataState

        private volatile WriteCtx.DataState dataState

      • dumpData

        long dumpData(FileOutputStream dumpOut,
            RandomAccessFile raf)
        throws IOException
        Writing the data into a local file. After the writing, if dataState is still ALLOW_DUMP, set data to null and set dataState to DUMPED.
        Throws:
        IOException
